title: About
text: I’m the Labor Economist for the Michigan Education Association where I conducts research on Michigan education finance as well as providing policy analysis and support for association bargaining units. Before joining MEA, I earned my PhD in Education Policy from Michigan State University where I worked with Dr. David Arsen.

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Okay, so all I have to do is add text here and it’ll just show up in the blog. Lets try showing some code:

library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.0     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
✔ ggplot2   3.4.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.0
✔ lubridate 1.9.2     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.1     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(TannersTools)
library(scales)


Attaching package: 'scales'

The following object is masked from 'package:purrr':

    discard

The following object is masked from 'package:readr':

    col_factor



fidr <- tt_import_fid_R()

here() starts at C:/Users/Tdelpier/OneDrive - Michigan Education Special Services Association/Desktop/R&D


Rows: 570635 Columns: 11
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (5): source, icode, isdname, dcode, dname
dbl (6): FY, fund, majorclass, suffix, amount, dnum

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

fidr %>% 
  filter(fund == 11) %>% 
  group_by(FY) %>% 
  summarise(amount = sum(amount) / 1000000000) %>% 
  tt_inf_deflate(amount, FY, 2022, deflator = "SLIPD") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(FY, amount.SLIPD.2022)) +
  geom_line() +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = dollar_format()) +
  labs(title = "Real General Fund Revenue",
       subtitle = "Billions",
       x = "",
       y = "") +
  theme_classic()

Inflation index year: 2022
Price index: State & Local Gov. Implicit Price Deflator, A829RD3A086NBEA
Joining with `by = join_by(FY)`
